conversation.message: Hello School_C—I'm Student_E. School_C is my first choice because I’m especially interested in your academic environment and would be excited to contribute and commit if admitted. I’m submitting my formal application and would be grateful for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. Although School_C ranks me 4th, applying immediately maximizes my chance before it fills with higher-priority applicants. If rejected, I can pivot next round to School_D or School_A, where my priority is stronger.

conversation.message: Student_E, thank you for your application and for placing School_C as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_C.
conversation.thought: Student_E is applying now and ranks 4th on School_C’s true priority list (behind Student_B, Student_C, Student_D). In the overall market, Student_B’s top choice is School_A; Student_C’s top choice is School_B; Student_D’s top choice is School_B; Student_A’s top choice is School_B. That means higher-priority students for School_C are likely to pursue other schools first, and may never apply to School_C (or may only do so after rejections). Meanwhile, Student_E has School_C as first choice and is applying immediately, giving high certainty of filling our single seat with an acceptable student. Given the one-seat quota and uncertainty of receiving applications from B/C/D soon (or at all), accepting Student_E now secures a match with a student on our priority list rather than risking ending unmatched.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would be excited to contribute actively to classes and school life. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would not improve my chances and could only risk losing the spot. I will submit a clear, enthusiastic application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications in this round, we are not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate the time and effort you put into your application and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_B, my priority order is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY messages from A, B, C, and D. Since my quota is 1 and higher-priority candidates (especially Student_B, Student_C, Student_D) are available right now, accepting Student_A would prevent me from matching with any of them. Student_A is my lowest-ranked acceptable student, so to maximize my outcome I should reject Student_A and keep the seat available for a higher-priority applicant. Also, Student_B prefers School_A first, so they may not end up at B, but I still have Student_C and Student_D (both rank above A for me) applying and listing School_B as first choice, so I can likely secure a better match than A by rejecting now.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_D and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m very motivated to join your community and would strongly commit if admitted. I believe I can contribute positively both academically and through school activities. Thank you for considering my application.

Although School_B ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_C), applying now is still my best chance to secure my first choice before capacity fills. I will express strong interest and fit, and ask to be considered seriously despite competition.

Student_B is ranked above Student_D and is currently applying to me, so accepting Student_D now would be suboptimal and would block a better match. Therefore I should reject Student_D this round.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and would commit to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.

Student_E (1st) has not applied to us and ranks School_B last, so unlikely to come. Given quota 1 and that we can secure a higher-priority student immediately, we should hold the seat for Student_B rather than accept Student_C now. Rejecting Student_C preserves our chance to match higher on our list; Student_C has School_C as next choice and is likely to find a match there.

conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions, I’m Student_B and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join School_B. Your academic environment and community are an excellent fit for my goals, and I would enthusiastically commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

I’m Student_C, and I’m writing to formally apply to School_D. After learning more about the process this round, I’m confident School_D is the best fit for me among the remaining options, and I would be excited to join your community.

If admitted, I will take the offer seriously and am prepared to enroll. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_C

Among unmatched schools (School_A, School_D, School_E), School_D is my highest remaining preference. I also have relatively decent priority at School_D (they rank me 3rd), so a direct application now gives a real chance to secure a match before capacity fills.

Given the rules, we cannot hold offers; rejecting would be dominated by accepting because Student_C is acceptable and reasonably high on our list.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions Committee,

After learning more about the options in this process, School_A stands out to me for its strong academic expectations and the balanced school experience it offers. I’m motivated to contribute positively in class and to the broader school community, and I would be grateful for the opportunity to join School_A.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_A

I also have relatively strong priority at School_A (3rd in their list), so applying now maximizes my chance of securing the best remaining outcome rather than risking losing School_A to a higher-priority student.
